First off, Sacred 2 runs fine with both win 8 and win 7 x64, so try the following steps one by one:
1.make sure your pc hardware supports the game, at least minimum requirement.
2.make sure your pc is installed with each of the following:
Visual C++ 2005 (x86) 8.0.61187
Visual C++ 2005 (x64) 8.0.61186
Visual C++ 2008 (x86) 9.0.30729.6313
Visual C++ 2008 (x64)9.0.30729.6313
Visual C++ 2010 (x86) 10.0.40219.414
Visual C++ 2010 (x64) 10.0.40219.414
Visual C++ 2012 (x86) 11.0.51106.1
Visual C++ 2012 (x64) 11.0.51106.1
Microsoft Visual F# 2.0 Runtime 10.0.40219
Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 sp1(included 2.0/3.0)
Microsoft .NET Framework 4.0
Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5(included 4.0, not supporting XP)
Microsoft XML Core Services 6.0 sp2 x86
Microsoft XML Core Services 6.0 sp2 x64
DirectX 9.0c (2010.6) (This should comes included with every win os since vista but sometimes missing certain dx9 dll file)
NVIDIA PhysX System Software 9.12.1031
3.get sacred community patch (unofficial but fix lots of bugs and glitches)
4.run game with admin rights
5.If you still cannot get it working, then modify the game's shortcut by adding the command " --nocpubinding --skipopenal" at the end of TARGET in shortcut properties - like this:
"C:Program Files (x86)Deep SilverSacred 2 - Fallen Angelsystemsacred2.exe" --nocpubinding --skipopenal
p/s: mind the blank space
5.Sacred 2 shouldn't be needed to run in compatibility mode. It's fully supported in win7 and win8.
6.If all fails, reinstall the game and try.
7.If still fails, check if your pc have trouble playing othe games
8.And lastly, may the force be with you.
